title: Start Your Day with Protein
content: Including protein in your breakfast helps maintain stable blood sugar levels and keeps you feeling full longer. Try adding beans, eggs, or yogurt to your morning meal.

title: Eat the Rainbow
content: Different colored fruits and vegetables provide different nutrients. Aim to include a variety of colors in your meals to ensure you're getting a wide range of vitamins and minerals.

title: Stay Hydrated
content: Water is essential for digestion, nutrient absorption, and overall health. Aim for 8 glasses per day, and remember that fruits and vegetables also contribute to your hydration.

title: Plan Meals Around Local Foods
content: Using locally available and seasonal foods is not only more affordable but also ensures you're getting fresh, nutrient-dense ingredients. Support local farmers and your health!

title: Combine Plant Proteins
content: Beans and rice, or lentils with whole grains, create complete proteins. This is especially important for vegetarian diets to ensure adequate protein intake.

title: Iron Absorption Tips
content: Pair iron-rich foods (like beans and leafy greens) with vitamin C sources (tomatoes, citrus) to enhance absorption. Avoid drinking tea or coffee with iron-rich meals.

title: Portion Control Matters
content: Even healthy foods can contribute to weight gain if portions are too large. Use your hand as a guide: palm for protein, fist for vegetables, cupped hand for carbs.

title: Fiber for Digestive Health
content: Aim for 25-30 grams of fiber daily from whole grains, legumes, fruits, and vegetables. Fiber helps maintain digestive health and keeps you feeling satisfied.
